🍱

eat

Whether it’s cooking it or consuming it, I love food. If I happen to get any free time you’re likely to find me in the kitchen where I’m either trying to faithfully recreate a dish from an episode of _Parts Unknown_ or attempting to make a vegetarian analog of a popular meat dish. Aside from Anthony Bourdain and his body of work (Kitchen Confidential, Mind of a Chef, etc.) I also cite Marcus Sameulsson’s No Passport Required and Eric Ripert https://twitter.com/ericripert as big influencers on me in this space.

👨🏻‍💻

code

Between QBasic, my first self-taught programming language, and Kotlin, my current obsession, there have been about a dozen languages. From procedural Pascal to functional Swift, my career has closely tracked with the latest trends in compilers, challenging me to keep learning or else fall behind. When possible, I’ve tried to carve out time to explore other areas of this amazing field we call computer science. Machine Learning, data science and signal processing are just a few of the concepts I’d like to try and tackle in this blog.

🛫

travel

The number of places I want to visit is far greater than the number of places I have visited. And as soon as I do check a city or experience off my bucket list, another one pops up that I want to try. I’m also fascinated by planes, from the increasingly rare B747 to the super jumbo A380. Their livery too is a joy to look at, attempting to package up an entire nation’s cultural ethos and slap it on a fuselage. So if you happen to spot me in an airport during a layover, it’ll probably be next to a window picking out tail numbers.
